alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 2:51PM PST until January 05 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Impact: At 15 feet Flooding of Highway 175 is expected as it approaches the Russian River bridge. Expect minor flooding of crop land on the right bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet - Forecast...The river will then rise above flood stage late tonight to 15.4 feet. It will fall below flood stage late Thursday evening to 9.6 feet. It will then rise above flood stage again Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM PST.
